intro: Ipomoea gagnepainii, commonly known as the Gagnepain's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant produces heart-shaped leaves and has a climbing habit, often using tendrils to support itself. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
